intro: Byrsonima tenuifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or pitanga, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, red, fleshy berries that are rich in vitamin C and have been used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and ecologically significant in its native habitats.
